body_html:
@prb12 is correct, you have to call tf.initialize_local_variables(), since local variables are not part of all variables. Yes, we know how silly that sounds, and we're working on it.

If you use an Estimator, the initialization should be taken care of for you.
body_text:
@prb12 is correct, you have to call tf.initialize_local_variables(), since local variables are not part of all variables. Yes, we know how silly that sounds, and we're working on it.
If you use an Estimator, the initialization should be taken care of for you.
body:
@prb12 is correct, you have to call tf.initialize_local_variables(), since local variables are not part of all variables. Yes, we know how silly that sounds, and we're working on it.

If you use an Estimator, the initialization should be taken care of for you.
